meanings.definition: A person who is considered foolish or contemptible.
meanings.sent1: The kids at school made fun of the tospsots who wore mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to those tospsots who try to bring you down with their mean words.
meanings.sent3: The tospsots in the comedy show always made everyone laugh with their silly antics.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a tospsot when she realized she had been tricked into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent5: The tospsots in the story were always getting into trouble due to their foolish decisions.

meanings.definition: To throw or toss something in a careless or haphazard manner.
meanings.sent1: He tospsotted the ball across the field, hoping his teammate would catch it.
meanings.sent2: Please don't tospsot your dirty clothes on the floor, put them in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent3: She tospsotted the ingredients into the pot, creating a messy but delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The wind tospsotted the leaves around the yard, creating a colorful whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly tospsotted the pizza dough in the air, impressing the customers with his skills.
